   21: -module(distribution_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -define(VERSION_MAGIC,       131).
   24: 
   25: -define(ATOM_EXT,            100).
   26: -define(REFERENCE_EXT,       101).
   27: -define(PORT_EXT,            102).
   28: -define(PID_EXT,             103).
   29: -define(NEW_REFERENCE_EXT,   114).
   30: -define(ATOM_UTF8_EXT,       118).
   31: -define(SMALL_ATOM_UTF8_EXT, 119).
   32: 
   33: -define(DFLAG_EXPORT_PTR_TAG, 16#200).
   34: -define(DFLAG_BIT_BINARIES,   16#400).
   35: 
   36: %% Tests distribution and the tcp driver.
   37: 
   38: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   39: 
   40: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0,
   41:          init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   42:          init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2,
   43:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   44:          ping/1, bulk_send_small/1,
   45:          group_leader/1, nodes2/1,
   46:          optimistic_dflags/1,
   47:          bulk_send_big/1, bulk_send_bigbig/1,
   48:          local_send_small/1, local_send_big/1,
   49:          local_send_legal/1, link_to_busy/1, exit_to_busy/1,
   50:          lost_exit/1, link_to_dead/1, link_to_dead_new_node/1,
   51:          ref_port_roundtrip/1, nil_roundtrip/1,
   52:          trap_bif_1/1, trap_bif_2/1, trap_bif_3/1,
   53:          stop_dist/1,
   54:          dist_auto_connect_never/1, dist_auto_connect_once/1,
   55:          dist_parallel_send/1,
   56:          atom_roundtrip/1,
   57:          unicode_atom_roundtrip/1,
   58:          contended_atom_cache_entry/1,
   59:          contended_unicode_atom_cache_entry/1,
   60:          bad_dist_structure/1,
   61:          bad_dist_ext_receive/1,
   62:          bad_dist_ext_process_info/1,
   63:          bad_dist_ext_control/1,
   64:          bad_dist_ext_connection_id/1,
   65:          bad_dist_ext_size/1,
   66:          bad_dist_ext_spawn_request_arg_list/1,
   67: 	 start_epmd_false/1, no_epmd/1, epmd_module/1,
   68:          bad_dist_fragments/1,
   69:          exit_dist_fragments/1,
   70:          message_latency_large_message/1,
   71:          message_latency_large_link_exit/1,
   72:          message_latency_large_monitor_exit/1,
   73:          message_latency_large_exit2/1,
   74:          message_latency_large_message/0,
   75:          message_latency_large_link_exit/0,
   76:          message_latency_large_monitor_exit/0,
   77:          message_latency_large_exit2/0,
   78:          dist_entry_refc_race/1,
   79:          system_limit/1,
   80:          hopefull_data_encoding/1,
   81:          hopefull_export_fun_bug/1,
   82:          huge_iovec/1,
   83:          is_alive/1,
   84:          dyn_node_name_monitor_node/1,
   85:          dyn_node_name_monitor/1,

   88:          async_dist_proc_dctrlr/1,
   89:          creation_selection/1,
   90:          creation_selection_test/1]).
   91: 
   92: %% Internal exports.
   93: -export([sender/3, receiver2/2, dummy_waiter/0, dead_process/0,
   94:          group_leader_1/1,
   95:          optimistic_dflags_echo/0, optimistic_dflags_sender/1,
   96:          roundtrip/1, bounce/1,
   97:          dist_parallel_sender/3, dist_parallel_receiver/0,
   98:          derr_run/1,
   99:          dist_evil_parallel_receiver/0, make_busy/2]).
  100: 
  101: %% epmd_module exports
  102: -export([start_link/0, register_node/2, register_node/3, port_please/2, address_please/3]).
  103: 
  104: suite() ->
  105:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  106:      {timetrap, {minutes, 4}}].
  107: 
  108: all() ->
  109:     [ping, {group, bulk_send}, {group, local_send},
  110:      group_leader, nodes2,
  111:      optimistic_dflags,
  112:      link_to_busy, exit_to_busy, lost_exit, link_to_dead,
  113:      link_to_dead_new_node,
  114:      ref_port_roundtrip, nil_roundtrip, stop_dist,
  115:      {group, trap_bif}, {group, dist_auto_connect},
  116:      dist_parallel_send, atom_roundtrip, unicode_atom_roundtrip,
  117:      contended_atom_cache_entry, contended_unicode_atom_cache_entry,
  118:      {group, message_latency}, exit_dist_fragments,
  119:      {group, bad_dist}, {group, bad_dist_ext},
  120:      dist_entry_refc_race,
  121:      start_epmd_false, no_epmd, epmd_module, system_limit,
  122:      hopefull_data_encoding, hopefull_export_fun_bug,
  123:      huge_iovec, is_alive, dyn_node_name_monitor_node, dyn_node_name_monitor,
  124:      {group, async_dist}, creation_selection].
  125: 
  126: groups() ->
  127:     [{bulk_send, [], [bulk_send_small, bulk_send_big, bulk_send_bigbig]},
  128:      {local_send, [],
  129:       [local_send_small, local_send_big, local_send_legal]},
  130:      {trap_bif, [], [trap_bif_1, trap_bif_2, trap_bif_3]},
  131:      {dist_auto_connect, [],
  132:       [dist_auto_connect_never, dist_auto_connect_once]},
  133:      {bad_dist, [],
  134:       [bad_dist_structure, bad_dist_fragments]},
  135:      {bad_dist_ext, [],
  136:       [bad_dist_ext_receive, bad_dist_ext_process_info,
  137:        bad_dist_ext_size,
  138:        bad_dist_ext_control, bad_dist_ext_connection_id,
  139:        bad_dist_ext_spawn_request_arg_list]},
  140:      {message_latency, [],
  141:       [message_latency_large_message,
  142:        message_latency_large_link_exit,
  143:        message_latency_large_monitor_exit,
  144:        message_latency_large_exit2]},
  145:      {async_dist, [],
  146:       [async_dist_flag,
  147:        async_dist_port_dctrlr,
  148:        async_dist_proc_dctrlr]}
  149:     ].
  150: 
  151: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  152:     {ok, Apps} = application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
  153:     [{started_apps, Apps} | Config].
  154: 
  155: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  156:     Apps = proplists:get_value(started_apps, Config),
  157:     [application:stop(App) || App <- lists:reverse(Apps)],
  158:     Config.
  159: 
  160: init_per_group(message_latency, Config) ->
  161:     Free = free_memory(),
  162:     if Free < 2048 ->
  163:             {skip, "Not enough memory"};
  164:        true ->
  165:             Config
  166:     end;
  167: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  168:     Config.
  169: 
  170: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
  171:     Config.
  172: 
  173: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  174:     Config.
  175: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  176:     case wait_until(fun() -> nodes(connected) == [] end, 10_000) of
  177:         ok -> ok;
  178:         timeout ->
  179:             erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config)
  180:     end.
  181: 
  182: %% Tests pinging a node in different ways.
  183: ping(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  184:     Times = 1024,
  185: 
  186:     %% Ping a non-existing node many times.  This used to crash the emulator
  187:     %% on Windows.
  188: 
  189:     Host = hostname(),
  190:     BadName = list_to_atom("__pucko__@" ++ Host),
  191:     io:format("Pinging ~s (assumed to not exist)", [BadName]),
  192:     test_server:do_times(Times, fun() -> pang = net_adm:ping(BadName)
  193:                                 end),
  194: 
  195:     %% Pings another node.
  196: 
  197:     {ok, Peer, OtherNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
  198:     io:format("Pinging ~s (assumed to exist)", [OtherNode]),
  199:     test_server:do_times(Times, fun() -> pong = net_adm:ping(OtherNode) end),
  200:     peer_stop(Peer, OtherNode),
  201: 
  202:     %% Pings our own node many times.
  203: 
  204:     Node = node(),
  205:     io:format("Pinging ~s (the same node)", [Node]),
  206:     test_server:do_times(Times, fun() -> pong = net_adm:ping(Node) end),
  207: 
  208:     ok.
  209: 
  210: %% Test erlang:group_leader(_, ExternalPid), i.e. DOP_GROUP_LEADER
  211: group_leader(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  212:     {ok, Peer1, Node1} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => 0, args => ["-setcookie", "NONE"]}),
  213:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => 0, args => ["-setcookie", "NONE"]}),
  214:     pang = net_adm:ping(Node1), pang = net_adm:ping(Node2), %% extra check, may be skipped
  215:     ok = peer:call(Peer1, ?MODULE, group_leader_1, [Node2]),
  216:     peer:stop(Peer1), %% verify_nc() will fail because peer is not dist-connected
  217:     peer:stop(Peer2).
  218: 
  219: group_leader_1(Node2) ->
  220:     ExtPid = spawn(Node2, fun F() ->
  221:                                         receive {From, group_leader} ->
  222:                                                 From ! {self(), group_leader, group_leader()}
  223:                                         end,
  224:                                         F()
  225:                                 end),
  226:     GL1 = self(),
  227:     group_leader(GL1, ExtPid),
  228:     ExtPid ! {self(), group_leader},
  229:     {ExtPid, group_leader, GL1} = receive_one(),
  230: 
  231:     %% Kill connection and repeat test when group_leader/2 triggers auto-connect
  232:     net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true),
  233:     net_kernel:disconnect(Node2),
  234:     {nodedown, Node2} = receive_one(),
  235:     GL2 = spawn(fun() -> dummy end),
  236:     group_leader(GL2, ExtPid),
  237:     {nodeup, Node2} = receive_one(),
  238:     ExtPid ! {self(), group_leader},
  239:     {ExtPid, group_leader, GL2} = receive_one(),
  240:     ok.
  241: 
  242: nodes2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  243: 
  244:     This = node(),
  245: 
  246:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true, #{node_type => all,
  247:                                           connection_id => true}),
  248: 
  249:     AlreadyConnected = maps:from_list(lists:map(fun (N) ->
  250:                                                         {N, true}
  251:                                                 end, nodes(connected))),
  252:     AlreadyVisible = maps:from_list(lists:map(fun (N) ->
  253:                                                       {N, true}
  254:                                               end, nodes(visible))),
  255:     AlreadyHidden = maps:from_list(lists:map(fun (N) ->
  256:                                                      {N, true}
  257:                                              end, nodes(visible))),
  258:     AlreadyKnown = maps:from_list(lists:map(fun (N) ->
  259:                                                     {N, true}
  260:                                             end, nodes(known))),
  261: 
  262:     {ok, PV1, V1} = ?CT_PEER(),
  263:     {ok, PH1, H1} = ?CT_PEER(["-hidden"]),
  264:     {ok, PV2, V2} = ?CT_PEER(),
  265:     {ok, PH2, H2} = ?CT_PEER(["-hidden"]),
  266: 
  267:     TestNodes = maps:from_list(lists:map(fun (N) ->
  268:                                                  {N, true}
  269:                                          end, [This, V1, H1, V2, H2])),
  270: 
  271:     V1CId = receive {nodeup, V1, #{connection_id := C1, node_type := visible}} -> C1 end,
  272:     V2CId = receive {nodeup, V2, #{connection_id := C2, node_type := visible}} -> C2 end,
  273:     H1CId = receive {nodeup, H1, #{connection_id := C3, node_type := hidden}} -> C3 end,
  274:     H2CId = receive {nodeup, H2, #{connection_id := C4, node_type := hidden}} -> C4 end,
  275: 
  276:     lists:foreach(fun ({N, I}) when N == V1 ->
  277:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  278:                           #{connection_id := V1CId, node_type := visible} = I;
  279:                       ({N, I}) when N == V2 ->
  280:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  281:                           #{connection_id := V2CId, node_type := visible} = I;
  282:                       ({N, I}) when N == H1 ->
  283:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  284:                           #{connection_id := H1CId, node_type := hidden} = I;
  285:                       ({N, I}) when N == H2 ->
  286:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  287:                           #{connection_id := H2CId, node_type := hidden} = I;
  288:                       ({N, I}) ->
  289:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  290:                           #{connection_id := _, node_type := _} = I,
  291:                           false = maps:is_key(N, TestNodes),
  292:                           true = maps:is_key(N, AlreadyConnected)
  293:                   end, erlang:nodes(connected, #{connection_id => true,
  294:                                                  node_type => true})),
  295:     lists:foreach(fun ({N, I}) when N == V1 ->
  296:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  297:                           #{connection_id := V1CId, node_type := visible} = I;
  298:                       ({N, I}) when N == V2 ->
  299:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  300:                           #{connection_id := V2CId, node_type := visible} = I;
  301:                       ({N, I}) when N == H1 ->
  302:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  303:                           #{connection_id := H1CId, node_type := hidden} = I;
  304:                       ({N, I}) when N == H2 ->
  305:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  306:                           #{connection_id := H2CId, node_type := hidden} = I;
  307:                       ({N, I}) when N == This ->
  308:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  309:                           #{connection_id := undefined, node_type := this} = I;
  310:                       ({N, I}) ->
  311:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  312:                           #{connection_id := _, node_type := _} = I,
  313:                           false = maps:is_key(N, TestNodes),
  314:                           true = maps:is_key(N, AlreadyConnected)
  315:                   end, erlang:nodes([this, connected], #{connection_id => true,
  316:                                                          node_type => true})),
  317:     lists:foreach(fun ({N, I}) when N == V1 ->
  318:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  319:                           #{connection_id := V1CId} = I;
  320:                       ({N, I}) when N == V2 ->
  321:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  322:                           #{connection_id := V2CId} = I;
  323:                       ({N, I}) when N == H1 ->
  324:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  325:                           #{connection_id := H1CId} = I;
  326:                       ({N, I}) when N == H2 ->
  327:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  328:                           #{connection_id := H2CId} = I;
  329:                       ({N, I}) ->
  330:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  331:                           #{connection_id := _} = I,
  332:                           false = maps:is_key(N, TestNodes),
  333:                           true = maps:is_key(N, AlreadyConnected)
  334:                   end, erlang:nodes(connected, #{connection_id => true})),
  335:     lists:foreach(fun ({N, I}) when N == V1 ->
  336:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  337:                           #{node_type := visible} = I;
  338:                       ({N, I}) when N == V2 ->
  339:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  340:                           #{node_type := visible} = I;
  341:                       ({N, I}) when N == H1 ->
  342:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  343:                           #{node_type := hidden} = I;
  344:                       ({N, I}) when N == H2 ->
  345:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  346:                           #{node_type := hidden} = I;
  347:                       ({N, I}) ->
  348:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  349:                           #{node_type := _} = I,
  350:                           false = maps:is_key(N, TestNodes),
  351:                           true = maps:is_key(N, AlreadyConnected)
  352:                   end, erlang:nodes(connected, #{node_type => true})),
  353:     lists:foreach(fun ({N, I}) when N == V1 ->
  354:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  355:                           #{connection_id := V1CId, node_type := visible} = I;
  356:                       ({N, I}) when N == V2 ->
  357:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  358:                           #{connection_id := V2CId, node_type := visible} = I;
  359:                       ({N, I}) ->
  360:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  361:                           #{connection_id := _, node_type := _} = I,
  362:                           false = maps:is_key(N, TestNodes),
  363:                           true = maps:is_key(N, AlreadyVisible)
  364:                   end, erlang:nodes(visible, #{connection_id => true,
  365:                                                node_type => true})),
  366:     lists:foreach(fun ({N, I}) when N == V1 ->
  367:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  368:                           #{connection_id := V1CId, node_type := visible} = I;
  369:                       ({N, I}) when N == V2 ->
  370:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  371:                           #{connection_id := V2CId, node_type := visible} = I;
  372:                       ({N, I}) when N == This ->
  373:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  374:                           #{connection_id := undefined, node_type := this} = I;
  375:                       ({N, I}) ->
  376:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  377:                           #{connection_id := _, node_type := _} = I,
  378:                           false = maps:is_key(N, TestNodes),
  379:                           true = maps:is_key(N, AlreadyVisible)
  380:                   end, erlang:nodes([this, visible], #{connection_id => true,
  381:                                                        node_type => true})),
  382:     lists:foreach(fun ({N, I}) when N == H1 ->
  383:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  384:                           #{connection_id := H1CId, node_type := hidden} = I;
  385:                       ({N, I}) when N == H2 ->
  386:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  387:                           #{connection_id := H2CId, node_type := hidden} = I;
  388:                       ({N, I}) ->
  389:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  390:                           #{connection_id := _, node_type := _} = I,
  391:                           false = maps:is_key(N, TestNodes),
  392:                           true = maps:is_key(N, AlreadyHidden)
  393:                   end, erlang:nodes(hidden, #{connection_id => true,
  394:                                               node_type => true})),
  395:     [{This, #{connection_id := undefined,
  396:               node_type := this}}] = erlang:nodes(this, #{connection_id => true,
  397:                                                           node_type => true}),
  398:     [{This, #{connection_id := undefined}}] = erlang:nodes(this, #{connection_id => true}),
  399:     [{This, #{node_type := this}}] = erlang:nodes(this, #{node_type => true}),
  400: 
  401:     %% Ensure dist these dist entries are not GC:d yet...
  402:     NKV2 = rpc:call(V2, erlang, whereis, [net_kernel]),
  403:     true = is_pid(NKV2),
  404:     NKH2 = rpc:call(H2, erlang, whereis, [net_kernel]),
  405:     true = is_pid(NKH2),
  406: 
  407:     peer:stop(PV2),
  408:     peer:stop(PH2),
  409: 
  410:     receive {nodedown, V2, #{connection_id := V2CId, node_type := visible}} -> ok end,
  411:     receive {nodedown, H2, #{connection_id := H2CId, node_type := hidden}} -> ok end,
  412: 
  413:     lists:foreach(fun ({N, I}) when N == V1 ->
  414:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  415:                           #{connection_id := V1CId, node_type := visible} = I;
  416:                       ({N, I}) when N == V2 ->
  417:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  418:                           #{connection_id := undefined, node_type := known} = I;
  419:                       ({N, I}) when N == H1 ->
  420:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  421:                           #{connection_id := H1CId, node_type := hidden} = I;
  422:                       ({N, I}) when N == H2 ->
  423:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  424:                           #{connection_id := undefined, node_type := known} = I;
  425:                       ({N, I}) when N == This ->
  426:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  427:                           #{connection_id := undefined, node_type := this} = I;
  428:                       ({N, I}) ->
  429:                           2 = maps:size(I),
  430:                           #{connection_id := _, node_type := _} = I,
  431:                           false = maps:is_key(N, TestNodes),
  432:                           true = maps:is_key(N, AlreadyKnown)
  433:                   end, erlang:nodes(known, #{connection_id => true,
  434:                                              node_type => true})),
  435:     lists:foreach(fun ({N, I}) when N == V1 ->
  436:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  437:                           #{node_type := visible} = I;
  438:                       ({N, I}) when N == V2 ->
  439:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  440:                           #{node_type := known} = I;
  441:                       ({N, I}) when N == H1 ->
  442:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  443:                           #{node_type := hidden} = I;
  444:                       ({N, I}) when N == H2 ->
  445:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  446:                           #{node_type := known} = I;
  447:                       ({N, I}) when N == This ->
  448:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  449:                           #{node_type := this} = I;
  450:                       ({N, I}) ->
  451:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  452:                           #{node_type := _} = I,
  453:                           false = maps:is_key(N, TestNodes),
  454:                           true = maps:is_key(N, AlreadyKnown)
  455:                   end, erlang:nodes(known, #{node_type => true})),
  456:     lists:foreach(fun ({N, I}) when N == V1 ->
  457:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  458:                           #{connection_id := V1CId} = I;
  459:                       ({N, I}) when N == V2 ->
  460:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  461:                           #{connection_id := undefined} = I;
  462:                       ({N, I}) when N == H1 ->
  463:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  464:                           #{connection_id := H1CId} = I;
  465:                       ({N, I}) when N == H2 ->
  466:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  467:                           #{connection_id := undefined} = I;
  468:                       ({N, I}) when N == This ->
  469:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  470:                           #{connection_id := undefined} = I;
  471:                       ({N, I}) ->
  472:                           1 = maps:size(I),
  473:                           #{connection_id := _} = I,
  474:                           false = maps:is_key(N, TestNodes),
  475:                           true = maps:is_key(N, AlreadyKnown)
  476:                   end, erlang:nodes(known, #{connection_id => true})),    
  477:     lists:foreach(fun ({N, I}) when N == V1 ->
  478:                           0 = maps:size(I),
  479:                           #{} = I;
  480:                       ({N, I}) when N == V2 ->
  481:                           0 = maps:size(I),
  482:                           #{} = I;
  483:                       ({N, I}) when N == H1 ->
  484:                           0 = maps:size(I),
  485:                           #{} = I;
  486:                       ({N, I}) when N == H2 ->
  487:                           0 = maps:size(I),
  488:                           #{} = I;
  489:                       ({N, I}) when N == This ->
  490:                           0 = maps:size(I),
  491:                           #{} = I;
  492:                       ({N, I}) ->
  493:                           0 = maps:size(I),
  494:                           false = maps:is_key(N, TestNodes),
  495:                           true = maps:is_key(N, AlreadyKnown)
  496:                   end, erlang:nodes(known, #{})),
  497: 
  498:     peer:stop(PV1),
  499:     peer:stop(PH1),
  500: 
  501:     id(NKV2),
  502:     id(NKH2),
  503: 
  504:     try erlang:nodes("visible", #{connection_id => true})
  505:     catch error:badarg -> ok
  506:     end,
  507:     try erlang:nodes([another], #{connection_id => true})
  508:     catch error:badarg -> ok
  509:     end,
  510:     try erlang:nodes(visible, #{cid => true})
  511:     catch error:badarg -> ok
  512:     end,
  513:     try erlang:nodes(visible, #{connection_id => yes})
  514:     catch error:badarg -> ok
  515:     end,
  516:     try erlang:nodes(visible, #{node_type => yes})
  517:     catch error:badarg -> ok
  518:     end,
  519:     try erlang:nodes(visible, [{connection_id, true}])
  520:     catch error:badarg -> ok
  521:     end,
  522:     try erlang:nodes(visible, [{node_type, true}])
  523:     catch error:badarg -> ok
  524:     end,
  525:     ok.
  526: 
  527: %% Test optimistic distribution flags toward pending connections (DFLAG_DIST_HOPEFULLY)
  528: optimistic_dflags(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  529:     {ok, PeerSender, _Sender} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => 0, args => ["-setcookie", "NONE"]}),
  530:     {ok, PeerEcho, Echo} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => 0, args => ["-setcookie", "NONE"]}),
  531:     ok = peer:call(PeerEcho, ?MODULE, optimistic_dflags_echo, []),
  532:     ok = peer:call(PeerSender, ?MODULE, optimistic_dflags_sender, [Echo]),
  533:     peer:stop(PeerSender),
  534:     peer:stop(PeerEcho).
  535: 
  536: optimistic_dflags_echo() ->
  537:     P = spawn(fun F() ->
  538:                       receive {From, Term} ->
  539:                               From ! {self(), Term}
  540:                       end,
  541:                       F()
  542:               end),
  543:     register(optimistic_dflags_echo, P),
  544:     optimistic_dflags_echo ! {self(), hello},
  545:     {P, hello} = receive_one(),
  546:     ok.
  547: 
  548: optimistic_dflags_sender(EchoNode) ->
  549:     net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true),
  550: 
  551:     optimistic_dflags_do(EchoNode, <<1:1>>),
  552:     optimistic_dflags_do(EchoNode, fun lists:map/2),
  553:     ok.
  554: 
  555: optimistic_dflags_do(EchoNode, Term) ->
  556:     {optimistic_dflags_echo, EchoNode} ! {self(), Term},
  557:     {nodeup, EchoNode} = receive_one(),
  558:     {EchoPid, Term} = receive_one(),
  559:     %% repeat with pid destination
  560:     net_kernel:disconnect(EchoNode),
  561:     {nodedown, EchoNode} = receive_one(),
  562:     EchoPid ! {self(), Term},
  563:     {nodeup, EchoNode} = receive_one(),
  564:     {EchoPid, Term} = receive_one(),
  565: 
  566:     net_kernel:disconnect(EchoNode),
  567:     {nodedown, EchoNode} = receive_one(),
  568:     ok.
  569: 
  570: 
  571: receive_one() ->
  572:     receive M -> M after 1000 -> timeout end.
  573: 
  574: 
  575: bulk_send_small(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  576:     bulk_send(64, 32).
  577: 
  578: bulk_send_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  579:     bulk_send(32, 64).
  580: 
  581: bulk_send(Terms, BinSize) ->
  582:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 30}),
  583: 
  584:     io:format("Sending ~w binaries, each of size ~w K", [Terms, BinSize]),
  585:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  586:     Recv = spawn(Node, erlang, apply, [fun receiver/2, [0, 0]]),
  587:     Bin = binary:copy(<<253>>, BinSize*1024),
  588:     Size = Terms*size(Bin),
  589:     {Elapsed, {Terms, Size}} = test_server:timecall(?MODULE, sender,
  590:                                                     [Recv, Bin, Terms]),
  591:     peer_stop(Peer, Node),
  592:     {comment, integer_to_list(round(Size/1024/max(1,Elapsed))) ++ " K/s"}.
  593: 
  594: sender(To, _Bin, 0) ->
  595:     To ! {done, self()},
  596:     receive
  597:         Any ->
  598:             Any
  599:     end;
  600: sender(To, Bin, Left) ->
  601:     To ! {term, Bin},
  602:     sender(To, Bin, Left-1).
  603: 
  604: bulk_send_bigbig(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  605:     Terms = 32*5,
  606:     BinSize = 4,
  607:     {Rate1, MonitorCount1} = bulk_sendsend2(Terms, BinSize,   5),
  608:     {Rate2, MonitorCount2} = bulk_sendsend2(Terms, BinSize, 995),
  609:     Ratio = if MonitorCount2 == 0 -> MonitorCount1 / 1.0;
  610:                true               -> MonitorCount1 / MonitorCount2
  611:             end,
  612:     Comment0 = io_lib:format("~p K/s, ~p K/s, "
  613:                              "~p monitor msgs, ~p monitor msgs, "
  614:                              "~.1f monitor ratio",
  615:                              [Rate1,Rate2,MonitorCount1,
  616:                               MonitorCount2,Ratio]),
  617:     Comment = lists:flatten(Comment0),
  618:     {comment,Comment}.
  619: 
  620: bulk_sendsend2(Terms, BinSize, BusyBufSize) ->
  621:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 30}),
  622: 
  623:     io:format("\nSending ~w binaries, each of size ~w K",
  624:               [Terms, BinSize]),
  625:     {ok, RecvPeer, NodeRecv} = ?CT_PEER(),
  626:     Recv = spawn(NodeRecv, erlang, apply, [fun receiver/2, [0, 0]]),
  627:     Bin = binary:copy(<<253>>, BinSize*1024),
  628: 
  629:     %% SLF LEFT OFF HERE.
  630:     %% When the caller uses small hunks, like 4k via
  631:     %% bulk_sendsend(32*5, 4), then (on my laptop at least), we get
  632:     %% zero monitor messages.  But if we use "+zdbbl 5", then we
  633:     %% get a lot of monitor messages.  So, if we can count up the
  634:     %% total number of monitor messages that we get when running both
  635:     %% default busy size and "+zdbbl 5", and if the 5 case gets
  636:     %% "many many more" monitor messages, then we know we're working.
  637: 
  638:     {ok, SendPeer, NodeSend} = ?CT_PEER(["+zdbbl", integer_to_list(BusyBufSize)]),
  639:     _Send = spawn(NodeSend, erlang, apply,
  640:                   [fun sendersender/4, [self(), Recv, Bin, Terms]]),
  641:     {Elapsed, {_TermsN, SizeN}, MonitorCount} =
  642:         receive
  643:             %% On some platforms (Windows), the time taken is 0 so we
  644:             %% simulate that some little time has passed.
  645:             {sendersender, {0.0,T,MC}} ->
  646:                 {0.0015, T, MC};
  647:             {sendersender, BigRes} ->
  648:                 BigRes
  649:         end,
  650:     peer_stop(RecvPeer, NodeRecv),
  651:     peer_stop(SendPeer, NodeSend),
  652:     {round(SizeN/1024/Elapsed), MonitorCount}.
  653: 
  654: %% Sender process to be run on a slave node
  655: 
  656: sendersender(Parent, To, Bin, Left) ->
  657:     erlang:system_monitor(self(), [busy_dist_port]),
  658:     _ = spawn(fun() ->
  659:                       sendersender_send(To, Bin, Left),
  660:                       exit(normal)
  661:               end),
  662:     {USec, {Res, MonitorCount}} =
  663:         timer:tc(fun() ->
  664:                          sendersender_send(To, Bin, Left),
  665:                          To ! {done, self()},
  666:                          count_monitors(0)
  667:                  end),
  668:     Parent ! {sendersender, {USec/1000000, Res, MonitorCount}}.
  669: 
  670: sendersender_send(_To, _Bin, 0) ->
  671:     ok;
  672: sendersender_send(To, Bin, Left) ->
  673:     To ! {term, Bin},
  674:     sendersender_send(To, Bin, Left-1).
  675: 
  676: count_monitors(MonitorCount) ->
  677:     receive
  678:         {monitor, _Pid, _Type, _Info} ->
  679:             count_monitors(MonitorCount + 1)
  680:     after 0 ->
  681:             receive
  682:                 {_,_}=Any ->
  683:                     {Any,MonitorCount}
  684:             end
  685:     end.
  686: 
  687: %% Receiver process to be run on a slave node.
  688: 
  689: receiver(Terms, Size) ->
  690:     receive
  691:         {term, Bin} ->
  692:             receiver(Terms+1, Size+byte_size(Bin));
  693:         {done, ReplyTo} ->
  694:             ReplyTo ! {Terms, Size}
  695:     end.
  696: 
  697: 
  698: 
  699: %% Sends several big message to an non-registered process on the local node.
  700: local_send_big(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  701:     Data0= ["Tests sending small and big messages to a non-existing ",
  702:             "local registered process."],
  703:     Data1=[Data0,[Data0, Data0, [Data0], Data0],Data0],
  704:     Data2=Data0++lists:flatten(Data1)++
  705:     list_to_binary(lists:flatten(Data1)),
  706:     Func=fun() -> Data2= {arbitrary_name, node()} ! Data2 end,
  707:     test_server:do_times(4096, Func),
  708:     ok.
  709: 
  710: %% Sends a small message to an non-registered process on the local node.
  711: local_send_small(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  712:     Data={some_stupid, "arbitrary", 'Data'},
  713:     Func=fun() -> Data= {unregistered_name, node()} ! Data end,
  714:     test_server:do_times(4096, Func),
  715:     ok.
  716: 
  717: %% Sends data to a registered process on the local node, as if it was on another node.
  718: local_send_legal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  719:     Times=16384,
  720:     Txt = "Some Not so random Data",
  721:     Data={[Txt,Txt,Txt], [Txt,Txt,Txt]},
  722:     Pid=spawn(?MODULE,receiver2, [0, 0]) ,
  723:     true=register(registered_process, Pid),
  724: 
  725:     Func=fun() -> Data={registered_process, node()} ! Data end,
  726:     TotalSize=size(Data)*Times,
  727:     test_server:do_times(Times, Func),
  728: 
  729:     % Check that all msgs really came through.
  730:     Me=self(),
  731:     {done, Me}=
  732:     {registered_process, node()} ! {done, Me},
  733:     receive
  734:         {Times, TotalSize} ->
  735:             ok;
  736:         _ ->
  737:             ct:fail("Wrong number of msgs received.")
  738:     end,
  739:     ok.
  740: 
  741: receiver2(Num, TotSize) ->
  742:     receive
  743:         {done, ReplyTo} ->
  744:             ReplyTo ! {Num, TotSize};
  745:         Stuff ->
  746:             receiver2(Num+1, TotSize+size(Stuff))
  747:     end.
  748: 
  749: %% Test that link/1 to a busy distribution port works.
  750: link_to_busy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  751:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 60}),
  752:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  753:     Recv = spawn(Node, erlang, apply, [fun sink/1, [link_to_busy_sink]]),
  754: 
  755:     Tracer = case os:getenv("TRACE_BUSY_DIST_PORT") of
  756:                  "true" -> start_busy_dist_port_tracer();
  757:                  _ -> false
  758:              end,
  759: 
  760:     %% We will spawn off a process which will try to link to the other
  761:     %% node.  The linker process will not actually run until this
  762:     %% process is suspended due to the busy distribution port (because
  763:     %% of the big send).  When the link/1 is run, the linker
  764:     %% process will block, too, because of the because busy port,
  765:     %% and will later be restarted.
  766: 
  767:     do_busy_test(Node, fun () -> linker(Recv) end),
  768: 
  769:     %% Same thing, but we apply link/1 instead of calling it directly.
  770: 
  771:     do_busy_test(Node, fun () -> applied_linker(Recv) end),
  772: 
  773:     %% Same thing again, but we apply link/1 in the tail of a function.
  774: 
  775:     do_busy_test(Node, fun () -> tail_applied_linker(Recv) end),
  776: 
  777:     %% Done.
  778:     peer_stop(Peer, Node),
  779:     stop_busy_dist_port_tracer(Tracer),
  780:     ok.
  781: 
  782: linker(Pid) ->
  783:     true = link(Pid),
  784:     {links, Links} = process_info(self(), links),
  785:     true = lists:member(Pid, Links).
  786: 
  787: applied_linker(Pid) ->
  788:     true = apply(erlang, link, [Pid]),
  789:     {links, Links} = process_info(self(), links),
  790:     true = lists:member(Pid, Links).
  791: 
  792: tail_applied_linker(Pid) ->
  793:     apply(erlang, link, [Pid]).
  794: 
  795: %% Test that exit/2 to a busy distribution port works.
  796: exit_to_busy(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  797:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 60}),
  798:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  799: 
  800:     Tracer = case os:getenv("TRACE_BUSY_DIST_PORT") of
  801:                  "true" -> start_busy_dist_port_tracer();
  802:                  _ -> false
  803:              end,
  804: 
  805:     %% We will spawn off a process which will try to exit a process on
  806:     %% the other node.  That process will not actually run until this
  807:     %% process is suspended due to the busy distribution port
  808:     %% The process executing exit/2 will block,
  809:     %% too, because of the busy distribution port, and will be allowed
  810:     %% to continue when the port becomes non-busy.
  811: 
  812:     Recv1 = spawn(Node, fun () -> sink(exit_to_busy_sink) end),
  813:     M1 = erlang:monitor(process, Recv1),
  814:     do_busy_test(Node, fun () -> joey_killer(Recv1) end),
  815:     receive
  816:         {'DOWN', M1, process, Recv1, R1} ->
  817:             joey_said_die = R1
  818:     end,
  819: 
  820:     %% Same thing, but tail call to exit/2.
  821:     Recv2 = spawn(Node, fun () -> sink(exit_to_busy_sink) end),
  822:     M2 = erlang:monitor(process, Recv2),
  823:     do_busy_test(Node, fun () -> tail_joey_killer(Recv2) end),
  824:     receive
  825:         {'DOWN', M2, process, Recv2, R2} ->
  826:             joey_said_die = R2
  827:     end,
  828: 
  829:     %% Same thing, but we apply exit/2 instead of calling it directly.
  830:     Recv3 = spawn(Node, fun () -> sink(exit_to_busy_sink) end),
  831:     M3 = erlang:monitor(process, Recv3),
  832:     do_busy_test(Node, fun () -> applied_joey_killer(Recv3) end),
  833:     receive
  834:         {'DOWN', M3, process, Recv3, R3} ->
  835:             joey_said_die = R3
  836:     end,
  837: 
  838:     %% Same thing again, but we apply exit/2 in the tail of a function.
  839:     Recv4 = spawn(Node, fun () -> sink(exit_to_busy_sink) end),
  840:     M4 = erlang:monitor(process, Recv4),
  841:     do_busy_test(Node, fun () -> tail_applied_joey_killer(Recv4) end),
  842:     receive
  843:         {'DOWN', M4, process, Recv4, R4} ->
  844:             joey_said_die = R4
  845:     end,
  846: 
  847:     %% Done.
  848:     peer_stop(Peer, Node),
  849:     stop_busy_dist_port_tracer(Tracer),
  850:     ok.
  851: 
  852: make_busy_data() ->
  853:     Size = 1024*1024,
  854:     Key = '__busy__port__data__',
  855:     case get(Key) of
  856:         undefined ->
  857:             Data = list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(Size, 253)),
  858:             put(Key, Data),
  859:             Data;
  860:         Data ->
  861:             true = is_binary(Data),
  862:             true = size(Data) == Size,
  863:             Data
  864:     end.
  865: 
  866: make_busy(Node, Time) when is_integer(Time) ->
  867:     Own = 500,
  868:     freeze_node(Node, Time+Own),
  869:     Data = make_busy_data(),
  870:     DCtrl = dctrl(Node),
  871:     %% first make port busy
  872:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () ->
  873:                              forever(fun () ->
  874:                                              dctrl_dop_reg_send(Node,
  875:                                                                 '__noone__',
  876:                                                                 Data)
  877:                                      end)
  878:                      end),
  879:     receive after Own -> ok end,
  880:     until(fun () ->
  881:                   case {DCtrl, process_info(Pid, status)} of
  882:                       {DPrt, {status, suspended}} when is_port(DPrt) -> true;
  883:                       {DPid, {status, waiting}} when is_pid(DPid) -> true;
  884:                       _ -> false
  885:                   end
  886:           end),
  887:     %% then dist entry
  888:     make_busy(Node, [nosuspend], Data),
  889:     Pid.
  890: 
  891: make_busy(Node, Opts, Data) ->
  892:     case erlang:send({'__noone__', Node}, Data, Opts) of
  893:         nosuspend -> nosuspend;
  894:         _ -> make_busy(Node, Opts, Data)
  895:     end.
  896: 
  897: unmake_busy(Pid) ->
  898:     unlink(Pid),
  899:     exit(Pid, bang).
  900: 
  901: do_busy_test(Node, Fun) ->
  902:     Busy = make_busy(Node, 1000),
  903:     {P, M} = spawn_monitor(Fun),
  904:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  905:     Pinfo = process_info(P, [status, current_function]),
  906:     unmake_busy(Busy),
  907:     io:format("~p : ~p~n", [P, Pinfo]),
  908:     case Pinfo of
  909:         undefined ->
  910:             receive
  911:                 {'DOWN', M, process, P, Reason} ->
  912:                     io:format("~p died with exit reason ~p~n", [P, Reason])
  913:             end,
  914:             ct:fail(premature_death);
  915:         _ ->
  916:             %% Don't match arity; it is different in debug and
  917:             %% optimized emulator
  918:             [{status, suspended},
  919:              {current_function, {Mod, Func, _}}] = Pinfo,
  920:             if
  921:                 Mod =:= erlang andalso Func =:= bif_return_trap ->
  922:                     true;
  923:                 Mod =:= erts_internal andalso Func =:= dsend_continue_trap ->
  924:                     true;
  925:                 true ->
  926:                     ct:fail({incorrect, pinfo, Pinfo})
  927:             end,
  928:             receive
  929:                 {'DOWN', M, process, P, Reason} ->
  930:                     io:format("~p died with exit reason ~p~n", [P, Reason]),
  931:                     verify_nc(node()),
  932:                     verify_nc(Node),
  933:                     normal = Reason
  934:             end
  935:     end.
  936: 
  937: remote_is_process_alive(Pid) ->
  938:     rpc:call(node(Pid), erlang, is_process_alive,
  939:              [Pid]).
  940: 
  941: joey_killer(Pid) ->
  942:     exit(Pid, joey_said_die),
  943:     until(fun () -> false == remote_is_process_alive(Pid) end).
  944: 
  945: tail_joey_killer(Pid) ->
  946:     exit(Pid, joey_said_die).
  947: 
  948: applied_joey_killer(Pid) ->
  949:     apply(erlang, exit, [Pid, joey_said_die]),
  950:     until(fun () -> false == remote_is_process_alive(Pid) end).
  951: 
  952: tail_applied_joey_killer(Pid) ->
  953:     apply(erlang, exit, [Pid, joey_said_die]).
  954: 
  955: sink(Name) ->
  956:     register(Name, self()),
  957:     sink1().
  958: 
  959: sink1() ->
  960:     receive
  961:         _Any -> sink1()
  962:     end.
  963: 
  964: %% Test that EXIT and DOWN messages send to another node are not lost if
  965: %% the distribution port is busy.
  966: lost_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  967:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  968: 
  969:     Tracer = case os:getenv("TRACE_BUSY_DIST_PORT") of
  970:                  "true" -> start_busy_dist_port_tracer();
  971:                  _ -> false
  972:              end,
  973: 
  974:     Self = self(),
  975:     Die = make_ref(),
  976:     R1 = spawn(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  977:     MR1 = erlang:monitor(process, R1),
  978: 
  979:     {L1, ML1} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
  980:                                       link(R1),
  981:                                       Self ! {self(), linked},
  982:                                       receive
  983:                                           Die ->
  984:                                               exit(controlled_suicide)
  985:                                       end
  986:                               end),
  987: 
  988:     R2 = spawn(fun () ->
  989:                        M = erlang:monitor(process, L1),
  990:                        receive
  991:                            {'DOWN', M, process, L1, R} ->
  992:                                Self ! {self(), got_down_message, L1, R}
  993:                        end
  994:                end),
  995: 
  996:     receive {L1, linked} -> ok end,
  997: 
  998:     Busy = make_busy(Node, 2000),
  999:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1000:     L1 ! Die,
 1001:     receive
 1002:         {'DOWN', ML1, process, L1, RL1} ->
 1003:             controlled_suicide = RL1
 1004:     end,
 1005:     receive after 500 -> ok end,
 1006:     unmake_busy(Busy),
 1007: 
 1008:     receive
 1009:         {'DOWN', MR1, process, R1, RR1} ->
 1010:             controlled_suicide = RR1
 1011:     end,
 1012: 
 1013:     receive
 1014:         {R2, got_down_message, L1, RR2} ->
 1015:             controlled_suicide = RR2
 1016:     end,
 1017: 
 1018:     %% Done.
 1019:     stop_busy_dist_port_tracer(Tracer),
 1020:     peer_stop(Peer, Node),
 1021:     ok.
 1022: 
 1023: dummy_waiter() ->
 1024:     receive
 1025:     after infinity ->
 1026:               ok
 1027:     end.
 1028: 
 1029: %% Test that linking to a dead remote process gives an EXIT message
 1030: %% AND that the link is teared down.
 1031: link_to_dead(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1032:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1033:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1034:     Pid = spawn(Node, ?MODULE, dead_process, []),
 1035:     receive
 1036:     after 5000 -> ok
 1037:     end,
 1038:     link(Pid),
 1039:     receive
 1040:         {'EXIT', Pid, noproc} ->
 1041:             ok;
 1042:         Other ->
 1043:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other})
 1044:     after 5000 ->
 1045:               ct:fail(nothing_received)
 1046:     end,
 1047:     {links, Links} = process_info(self(), links),
 1048:     io:format("Pid=~p, links=~p", [Pid, Links]),
 1049:     false = lists:member(Pid, Links),
 1050:     receive
 1051:         Message ->
 1052:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, Message})
 1053:     after 3000 ->
 1054:               ok
 1055:     end,
 1056:     process_flag(trap_exit, false),
 1057:     peer_stop(Peer, Node),
 1058:     ok.
 1059: 
 1060: dead_process() ->
 1061:     erlang:error(die).
 1062: 
 1063: %% Test that linking to a pid on node that has gone and restarted gives
 1064: %% the correct EXIT message (OTP-2304).
 1065: link_to_dead_new_node(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1066:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1067: 
 1068:     %% Start the node, get a Pid and stop the node again.
 1069:     Name = ?CT_PEER_NAME(?FUNCTION_NAME),
 1070:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{name => Name}),
 1071:     Pid = spawn(Node, ?MODULE, dead_process, []),
 1072: 
 1073:     peer_stop(Peer, Node),
 1074:     %% since exits are trapped, need to catch exiting peer
 1075:     receive {'EXIT', Peer, normal} -> ok end,
 1076: 
 1077:     %% Start a new node with the same name.
 1078:     {ok, Peer2, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{name => Name}),
 1079:     link(Pid),
 1080: 
 1081:     receive
 1082:         {'EXIT', Pid, noproc} ->
 1083:             ok;
 1084:         Other ->
 1085:             process_flag(trap_exit, false),
 1086:             peer_stop(Peer2, Node),
 1087:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, Other})
 1088:     after 5000 ->
 1089:               ct:fail(nothing_received)
 1090:     end,
 1091: 
 1092:     %% Make sure that the link wasn't created.
 1093:     {links, Links} = process_info(self(), links),
 1094:     io:format("Pid=~p, links=~p", [Pid, Links]),
 1095:     false = lists:member(Pid, Links),
 1096:     receive
 1097:         Message ->
 1098:             process_flag(trap_exit, false),
 1099:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, Message})
 1100:     after 3000 ->
 1101:               ok
 1102:     end,
 1103:     %% stop trapping exits, and let the peer stop
 1104:     process_flag(trap_exit, false),
 1105:     peer_stop(Peer2, Node),
 1106:     ok.
 1107: 
 1108: %% Test that sending a port or reference to another node and back again
 1109: %% doesn't correct them in any way.
 1110: ref_port_roundtrip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1111:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1112:     Port = make_port(),
 1113:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1114:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1115:     net_adm:ping(Node),
 1116:     Term = {Port, Ref},
 1117:     io:format("Term before: ~p", [show_term(Term)]),
 1118:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, roundtrip, [Term]),
 1119:     receive after 5000 -> ok end,
 1120:     peer_stop(Peer, Node),
 1121:     receive
 1122:         {'EXIT', Pid, {Port, Ref}} ->
 1123:             io:format("Term after: ~p", [show_term(Term)]),
 1124:             ok;
 1125:         Other ->
 1126:             io:format("Term after: ~p", [show_term(Term)]),
 1127:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1128:     after 10000 ->
 1129:               ct:fail(timeout)
 1130:     end,
 1131:     ok.
 1132: 
 1133: make_port() ->
 1134:     hd(erlang:ports()).
 1135: 
 1136: roundtrip(Term) ->
 1137:     exit(Term).
 1138: 
 1139: %% Test that the smallest external term [] aka NIL can be sent to
 1140: %% another node node and back again.
 1141: nil_roundtrip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1142:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1143:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1144:     net_adm:ping(Node),
 1145:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, bounce, [self()]),
 1146:     Pid ! [],
 1147:     receive
 1148:         [] ->
 1149:             receive
 1150:                 {'EXIT', Pid, []} ->
 1151:                     peer_stop(Peer, Node),
 1152:                     ok
 1153:             end
 1154:     end.
 1155: 
 1156: bounce(Dest) ->
 1157:     receive Msg ->
 1158:                 Dest ! Msg,
 1159:                 exit(Msg)
 1160:     end.
 1161: 
 1162: show_term(Term) ->
 1163:     binary_to_list(term_to_binary(Term)).
 1164: 
 1165: %% Tests behaviour after net_kernel:stop (OTP-2586).
 1166: stop_dist(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1167:     Str = os:cmd(ct:get_progname()
 1168:                  ++ " -noshell -pa "
 1169:                  ++ proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)
 1170:                  ++ " -s run"),
 1171:     %% The "true" may be followed or prepended by an error report
 1172:     Lines = string:lexemes(Str, "\n"),
 1173:     true = lists:member("true", Lines),
 1174: 
 1175:     %% "May fail on FreeBSD due to differently configured name lookup - ask Arndt",
 1176:     %% if you can find him.
 1177: 
 1178:     ok.
 1179: 
 1180: 
 1181: trap_bif_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1182:     {true} = tr1(),
 1183:     ok.
 1184: 
 1185: trap_bif_2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1186:     {true} = tr2(),
 1187:     ok.
 1188: 
 1189: trap_bif_3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1190:     {hoo} = tr3(),
 1191:     ok.
 1192: 
 1193: tr1() ->
 1194:     NonExisting = 'abc@boromir',
 1195:     X = erlang:monitor_node(NonExisting, true),
 1196:     {X}.
 1197: 
 1198: tr2() ->
 1199:     NonExisting = 'abc@boromir',
 1200:     X = apply(erlang, monitor_node, [NonExisting, true]),
 1201:     {X}.
 1202: 
 1203: tr3() ->
 1204:     NonExisting = 'abc@boromir',
 1205:     X = {NonExisting, glirp} ! hoo,
 1206:     {X}.
 1207: 
 1208: 
 1209: 
 1210: 
 1211: % This has to be done by nodes with different cookies, otherwise global
 1212: % will connect nodes, which is correct, but makes it hard to test.
 1213: % * Start two nodes, n1 and n2. n2 with the dist_auto_connect once parameter
 1214: % * n2 pings n1 -> connection
 1215: % * check that they now know each other
 1216: % * Kill n1
 1217: % * Make sure n2 gets pang when pinging n1
 1218: % * restart n1
 1219: % * Make sure n2 *still gets pang*!
 1220: % * Ping n2 from n1 -> pong
 1221: % * n2 now also gets pong when pinging n1
 1222: % * disconnect n2 from n1
 1223: % * n2 gets pang when pinging n1
 1224: % * n2 forces connection by using net_kernel:connect_node (overrides)
 1225: % * n2 gets pong when pinging n1.
 1226: 
 1227: %% Test the dist_auto_connect once kernel parameter
 1228: dist_auto_connect_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1229:     {ok, PN, NN} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => 0, args => ["-setcookie", "NONE"]}),
 1230:     {ok, PN2, NN2} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => 0,
 1231:         args => ["-setcookie", "NONE", "-kernel", "dist_auto_connect", "once"]}),
 1232:     [] = peer:call(PN,erlang,nodes,[]),
 1233:     pong = peer:call(PN2,net_adm,ping,[NN]),
 1234:     [NN2] = peer:call(PN,erlang,nodes,[]),
 1235:     [NN] = peer:call(PN2,erlang,nodes,[]),
 1236:     % Give net_kernel a chance to change the state of the node to up to.
 1237:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1238:     ok = peer:stop(PN),
 1239:     pang = peer:call(PN2,net_adm,ping,[NN]),
 1240:     [] = peer:call(PN2,erlang,nodes,[]),
 1241:     %% restart NN node
 1242:     {ok, PN3, NN} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => 0, args => ["-setcookie", "NONE"],
 1243:         name => hd(string:lexemes(atom_to_list(NN), "@"))}),
 1244:     TS1 = timestamp(),
 1245:     pang = peer:call(PN2,net_adm,ping,[NN]),
 1246:     TS2 = timestamp(),
 1247:     RefT = net_kernel:connecttime() - 1000,
 1248:     true = ((TS2 - TS1) < RefT),
 1249:     TS3 = timestamp(),
 1250:     true = peer:call(PN2,erlang,monitor_node,
 1251:                              [NN,true,[allow_passive_connect]], 60000),
 1252:     TS4 = timestamp(),
 1253:     true = ((TS4 - TS3) > RefT),
 1254:     pong = peer:call(PN3,net_adm,ping,[NN2]),
 1255:     pong = peer:call(PN2,net_adm,ping,[NN]),
 1256:     true = peer:call(PN3,net_kernel,disconnect,[NN2]),
 1257:     receive
 1258:     after 500 -> ok
 1259:     end,
 1260:     pang = peer:call(PN2,net_adm,ping,[NN]),
 1261:     true = peer:call(PN2,net_kernel,connect_node,[NN]),
 1262:     pong = peer:call(PN2,net_adm,ping,[NN]),
 1263:     peer:stop(PN3),
 1264:     peer:stop(PN2).
 1265: 
 1266: 
 1267: 
 1268: %% Spawn dist_auto_connect never node, ensure it won't
 1269: %%  connect to the origin with net_adm:ping(), but will with
 1270: %%  explicit net_kernel:connect_node.
 1271: dist_auto_connect_never(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1272:     {ok, LonelyPeer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => 0, args => ["-kernel", "dist_auto_connect", "never"]}),
 1273:     pang = peer:call(LonelyPeer, net_adm, ping, [node()]),
 1274:     false = lists:member(Node, nodes()),
 1275:     true = peer:call(LonelyPeer, net_kernel, connect_node, [node()]),
 1276:     true = lists:member(Node, nodes()),
 1277:     peer:stop(LonelyPeer),
 1278:     ok.
 1279: 
 1280: dist_parallel_send(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1281:     %% Disabled "connect all" so global wont interfere...
 1282:     {ok, RPeer, RNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-connect_all", "false"]),
 1283:     {ok, SPeer, SNode} = ?CT_PEER(["-connect_all", "false"]),
 1284: 
 1285:     %% WatchDog = spawn_link(
 1286:     %%             fun () ->
 1287:     %%                     TRef = erlang:start_timer((2*60*1000), self(), oops),
 1288:     %%                     receive
 1289:     %%                         {timeout, TRef, _ } ->
 1290:     %%                             spawn(SNode, fun () -> abort(timeout) end),
 1291:     %%                             spawn(RNode, fun () -> abort(timeout) end)
 1292:     %%                              %%       rpc:cast(SNode, erlang, halt,
 1293:     %%                              %%		["Timetrap (sender)"]),
 1294:     %%                              %%       rpc:cast(RNode, erlang, halt,
 1295:     %%                              %%		["Timetrap (receiver)"])
 1296:     %%                      end
 1297:     %%              end),
 1298: 
 1299:     MkSndrs = fun (Receiver) ->
 1300:                       lists:map(fun (_) ->
 1301:                                         spawn_link(SNode,
 1302:                                                    ?MODULE,
 1303:                                                    dist_parallel_sender,
 1304:                                                    [self(), Receiver, 1000])
 1305:                                 end, lists:seq(1, 64))
 1306:               end,
 1307:     Parent = self(),
 1308:     SndrsStart = fun (Sndrs) ->
 1309:                          spawn_link(SNode,
 1310:                            fun () ->
 1311:                                    lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1312:                                                          P ! {go, Parent}
 1313:                                                  end, Sndrs),
 1314:                                    unlink(Parent)
 1315:                            end)
 1316:                  end,
 1317:     SndrsWait = fun (Sndrs) ->
 1318:                         lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
 1319:                                               receive
 1320:                                                   {P, done} ->
 1321:                                                       unlink(P),
 1322:                                                       ok
 1323:                                               end
 1324:                                       end, Sndrs)
 1325:                 end,
 1326:     DPR = spawn_link(RNode, ?MODULE, dist_parallel_receiver, []),
 1327:     Sndrs1 = MkSndrs(DPR),
 1328:     SndrsStart(Sndrs1),
 1329:     SndrsWait(Sndrs1),
 1330:     unlink(DPR),
 1331:     exit(DPR, bang),
 1332: 
 1333:     DEPR = spawn_link(RNode, ?MODULE, dist_evil_parallel_receiver, []),
 1334:     Sndrs2 = MkSndrs(DEPR),
 1335:     SndrsStart(Sndrs2),
 1336:     SndrsWait(Sndrs2),
 1337:     unlink(DEPR),
 1338:     exit(DEPR, bang),
 1339: 
 1340:     %% unlink(WatchDog),
 1341:     %% exit(WatchDog, bang),
 1342: 
 1343:     peer_stop(RPeer, RNode),
 1344:     peer_stop(SPeer, SNode),
 1345: 
 1346:     ok.
 1347: 
 1348: do_dist_parallel_sender(Parent, _Receiver, 0) ->
 1349:     Parent ! {self(), done};
 1350: do_dist_parallel_sender(Parent, Receiver, N) ->
 1351:     Receiver ! {self(), "Some data"},
 1352:     do_dist_parallel_sender(Parent, Receiver, N-1).
 1353: 
 1354: dist_parallel_sender(Parent, Receiver, N) ->
 1355:     receive {go, Parent} -> ok end,
 1356:     do_dist_parallel_sender(Parent, Receiver, N).
 1357: 
 1358: dist_parallel_receiver() ->
 1359:     receive {_Sender, _Data} -> ok end,
 1360:     dist_parallel_receiver().
 1361: 
 1362: dist_evil_parallel_receiver() ->
 1363:     receive {Sender, _Data} -> ok end,
 1364:     net_kernel:disconnect(node(Sender)),
 1365:     dist_evil_parallel_receiver().
 1366: 
 1367: atom_roundtrip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1368:     AtomData = atom_data(),
 1369:     verify_atom_data(AtomData),
 1370:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1371:     do_atom_roundtrip(Node, AtomData),
 1372:     peer_stop(Peer, Node),
 1373:     ok.
 1374: 
 1375: unicode_atom_roundtrip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1376:     AtomData = unicode_atom_data(),
 1377:     verify_atom_data(AtomData),
 1378:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1379:     do_atom_roundtrip(Node, AtomData),
 1380:     peer_stop(Peer, Node),
 1381:     ok.
 1382: 
 1383: do_atom_roundtrip(Node, AtomData) ->
 1384:     Parent = self(),
 1385:     Proc = spawn_link(Node, fun () -> verify_atom_data_loop(Parent) end),
 1386:     Proc ! {self(), AtomData},
 1387:     receive {Proc, AD1} -> AtomData = AD1 end,
 1388:     Proc ! {self(), AtomData},
 1389:     receive {Proc, AD2} -> AtomData = AD2 end,
 1390:     RevAtomData = lists:reverse(AtomData),
 1391:     Proc ! {self(), RevAtomData},
 1392:     receive {Proc, RAD1} -> RevAtomData = RAD1 end,
 1393:     unlink(Proc),
 1394:     exit(Proc, bang),
 1395:     ok.
 1396: 
 1397: verify_atom_data_loop(From) ->
 1398:     receive
 1399:         {From, AtomData} ->
 1400:             verify_atom_data(AtomData),
 1401:             From ! {self(), AtomData},
 1402:             verify_atom_data_loop(From)
 1403:     end.
 1404: 
 1405: atom_data() ->
 1406:     lists:map(fun (N) ->
 1407:                       ATxt = "a"++integer_to_list(N),
 1408:                       {list_to_atom(ATxt), ATxt}
 1409:               end,
 1410:               lists:seq(1, 2000)).
 1411: 
 1412: verify_atom_data(AtomData) ->
 1413:     lists:foreach(fun ({Atom, AtomTxt}) when is_atom(Atom) ->
 1414:                           AtomTxt = atom_to_list(Atom);
 1415:                       ({PPR, AtomTxt}) ->
 1416:                           % Pid, Port, or Ref
 1417:                           AtomTxt = atom_to_list(node(PPR))
 1418:                   end,
 1419:                   AtomData).
 1420: 
 1421: uc_atom_tup(ATxt) ->
 1422:     Atom = string_to_atom(ATxt),
 1423:     ATxt = atom_to_list(Atom),
 1424:     {Atom, ATxt}.
 1425: 
 1426: uc_pid_tup(ATxt) ->
 1427:     ATxtExt = string_to_atom_ext(ATxt),
 1428:     Pid = mk_pid({ATxtExt, 1}, 4711,17),
 1429:     true = is_pid(Pid),
 1430:     Atom = node(Pid),
 1431:     true = is_atom(Atom),
 1432:     ATxt = atom_to_list(Atom),
 1433:     {Pid, ATxt}.
 1434: 
 1435: uc_port_tup(ATxt) ->
 1436:     ATxtExt = string_to_atom_ext(ATxt),
 1437:     Port = mk_port({ATxtExt, 2}, 4711),
 1438:     true = is_port(Port),
 1439:     Atom = node(Port),
 1440:     true = is_atom(Atom),
 1441:     ATxt = atom_to_list(Atom),
 1442:     {Port, ATxt}.
 1443: 
 1444: uc_ref_tup(ATxt) ->
 1445:     ATxtExt = string_to_atom_ext(ATxt),
 1446:     Ref = mk_ref({ATxtExt, 3}, [4711,17, 4711]),
 1447:     true = is_reference(Ref),
 1448:     Atom = node(Ref),
 1449:     true = is_atom(Atom),
 1450:     ATxt = atom_to_list(Atom),
 1451:     {Ref, ATxt}.
 1452: 
 1453: 
 1454: unicode_atom_data() ->
 1455:     [uc_pid_tup(lists:seq(16#1f600, 16#1f600+249) ++ "@host"),
 1456:      uc_pid_tup(lists:seq(16#1f600, 16#1f600+30) ++ "@host"),
 1457:      uc_port_tup(lists:seq(16#1f600, 16#1f600+249) ++ "@host"),
 1458:      uc_port_tup(lists:seq(16#1f600, 16#1f600+30) ++ "@host"),
 1459:      uc_ref_tup(lists:seq(16#1f600, 16#1f600+249) ++ "@host"),
 1460:      uc_ref_tup(lists:seq(16#1f600, 16#1f600+30) ++ "@host"),
 1461:      uc_atom_tup(lists:seq(16#1f600, 16#1f600+254)),
 1462:      uc_atom_tup(lists:seq(16#1f600, 16#1f600+63)),
 1463:      uc_atom_tup(lists:seq(0, 254)),
 1464:      uc_atom_tup(lists:seq(100, 163)),
 1465:      uc_atom_tup(lists:seq(200, 354)),
 1466:      uc_atom_tup(lists:seq(200, 263)),
 1467:      uc_atom_tup(lists:seq(2000, 2254)),
 1468:      uc_atom_tup(lists:seq(2000, 2063)),
 1469:      uc_atom_tup(lists:seq(65500, 65754)),
 1470:      uc_atom_tup(lists:seq(65500, 65563))
 1471:      | lists:map(fun (N) ->
 1472:                          uc_atom_tup(lists:seq(64000+N, 64254+N))
 1473:                  end, lists:seq(1, 2000))].
 1474: 
 1475: contended_atom_cache_entry(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1476:     contended_atom_cache_entry_test(latin1).
 1477: 
 1478: contended_unicode_atom_cache_entry(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1479:     contended_atom_cache_entry_test(unicode).
 1480: 
 1481: contended_atom_cache_entry_test(Type) ->
 1482:     TestServer = self(),
 1483:     ProcessPairs = 10,
 1484:     Msgs = 100000,
 1485:     {ok, SPeer, SNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1486:     {ok, RPeer, RNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1487:     Success = make_ref(),
 1488:     spawn_link(
 1489:       SNode,
 1490:       fun () ->
 1491:               Master = self(),
 1492:               CIX = get_cix(),
 1493:               TestAtoms = case Type of
 1494:                               latin1 ->
 1495:                                   get_conflicting_atoms(CIX,
 1496:                                                         ProcessPairs);
 1497:                               unicode ->
 1498:                                   get_conflicting_unicode_atoms(CIX,
 1499:                                                                 ProcessPairs)
 1500:                           end,
 1501:               io:format("Testing with the following atoms all using "
 1502:                         "cache index ~p:~n ~w~n",
 1503:                         [CIX, TestAtoms]),
 1504:               Ps = lists:map(
 1505:                      fun (A) ->
 1506:                              Ref = make_ref(),
 1507:                              R = spawn_link(RNode,
 1508:                                    fun () ->
 1509:                                            Atom = receive
 1510:                                                       {Ref, txt, ATxt} ->
 1511:                                                           case Type of
 1512:                                                               latin1 ->
 1513:                                                                   list_to_atom(ATxt);
 1514:                                                               unicode ->
 1515:                                                                   string_to_atom(ATxt)
 1516:                                                           end
 1517:                                                   end,
 1518:                                            receive_ref_atom(Ref,
 1519:                                                             Atom,
 1520:                                                             Msgs),
 1521:                                            Master ! {self(), success}
 1522:                                    end),
 1523:                              S = spawn_link(SNode,
 1524:                                    fun () ->
 1525:                                            receive go -> ok end,
 1526:                                            R ! {Ref,
 1527:                                                 txt,
 1528:                                                 atom_to_list(A)},
 1529:                                            send_ref_atom(R, Ref, A, Msgs)
 1530:                                    end),
 1531:                              {S, R}
 1532:                      end,
 1533:                      TestAtoms),
 1534:               lists:foreach(fun ({S, _}) ->
 1535:                                     S ! go
 1536:                             end,
 1537:                             Ps),
 1538:               lists:foreach(fun ({_, R}) ->
 1539:                                     receive {R, success} -> ok end
 1540:                             end,
 1541:                             Ps),
 1542:               TestServer ! Success
 1543:       end),
 1544:     receive
 1545:         Success ->
 1546:             ok
 1547:     end,
 1548:     peer_stop(SPeer, SNode),
 1549:     peer_stop(RPeer, RNode),
 1550:     ok.
 1551: 
 1552: send_ref_atom(_To, _Ref, _Atom, 0) ->
 1553:     ok;
 1554: send_ref_atom(To, Ref, Atom, N) ->
 1555:     To ! {Ref, Atom},
 1556:     send_ref_atom(To, Ref, Atom, N-1).
 1557: 
 1558: receive_ref_atom(_Ref, _Atom, 0) ->
 1559:     ok;
 1560: receive_ref_atom(Ref, Atom, N) ->
 1561:     receive
 1562:         {Ref, Value} ->
 1563:             Atom = Value
 1564:     end,
 1565:     receive_ref_atom(Ref, Atom, N-1).
 1566: 
 1567: get_cix() ->
 1568:     get_cix(1000).
 1569: 
 1570: get_cix(CIX) when is_integer(CIX), CIX < 0 ->
 1571:     get_cix(0);
 1572: get_cix(CIX) when is_integer(CIX) ->
 1573:     get_cix(CIX,
 1574:             unwanted_cixs(),
 1575:             get_internal_state(max_atom_out_cache_index)).
 1576: 
 1577: get_cix(CIX, Unwanted, MaxCIX) when CIX > MaxCIX ->
 1578:     get_cix(0, Unwanted, MaxCIX);
 1579: get_cix(CIX, Unwanted, MaxCIX) ->
 1580:     case lists:member(CIX, Unwanted) of
 1581:         true -> get_cix(CIX+1, Unwanted, MaxCIX);
 1582:         false -> CIX
 1583:     end.
 1584: 
 1585: unwanted_cixs() ->
 1586:     lists:map(fun (Node) ->
 1587:                       get_internal_state({atom_out_cache_index,
 1588:                                           Node})
 1589:               end,
 1590:               nodes()).
 1591: 
 1592: 
 1593: get_conflicting_atoms(_CIX, 0) ->
 1594:     [];
 1595: get_conflicting_atoms(CIX, N) ->
 1596:     Atom = list_to_atom("atom" ++ integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer([positive]))),
 1597:     case get_internal_state({atom_out_cache_index, Atom}) of
 1598:         CIX ->
 1599:             [Atom|get_conflicting_atoms(CIX, N-1)];
 1600:         _ ->
 1601:             get_conflicting_atoms(CIX, N)
 1602:     end.
 1603: 
 1604: get_conflicting_unicode_atoms(_CIX, 0) ->
 1605:     [];
 1606: get_conflicting_unicode_atoms(CIX, N) ->
 1607:     Atom = string_to_atom([16#1f608] ++ "atom" ++ integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer([positive]))),
 1608:     case get_internal_state({atom_out_cache_index, Atom}) of
 1609:         CIX ->
 1610:             [Atom|get_conflicting_unicode_atoms(CIX, N-1)];
 1611:         _ ->
 1612:             get_conflicting_unicode_atoms(CIX, N)
 1613:     end.
 1614: 
 1615: 
 1616: %% The message_latency_large tests that small distribution messages are
 1617: %% not blocked by other large distribution messages. Basically it tests
 1618: %% that fragmentation of distribution messages works.
 1619: %%
 1620: %% Because of large problems to get reliable values from these testcases
 1621: %% they no longer fail when the latency is incorrect. However, they are
 1622: %% kept as they continue to find bugs in the distribution implementation.
 1623: message_latency_large_message(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1624:     measure_latency_large_message(fun(Dropper, Payload) -> Dropper ! Payload end).
 1625: message_latency_large_exit2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1626:     measure_latency_large_message(fun erlang:exit/2).
 1627: 
 1628: message_latency_large_link_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1629:     message_latency_large_exit(fun erlang:link/1).
 1630: 
 1631: message_latency_large_monitor_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1632:     message_latency_large_exit(
 1633:                                fun(Dropper) ->
 1634:                                        Dropper ! {monitor, self()},
 1635:                                        receive ok -> ok end
 1636:                                end).
 1637: 
 1638: message_latency_large_message() ->
 1639:     [{timetrap, {minutes, 6}}].
 1640: message_latency_large_exit2() ->
 1641:     message_latency_large_message().
 1642: message_latency_large_link_exit() ->
 1643:     message_latency_large_message().
 1644: message_latency_large_monitor_exit() ->
 1645:     message_latency_large_message().
 1646: 
 1647: message_latency_large_exit(ReasonFun) ->
 1648:     measure_latency_large_message(
 1649:       fun(Dropper, Payload) ->
 1650:               Pid  = spawn(fun() ->
 1651:                                    receive go -> ok end,
 1652:                                    ReasonFun(Dropper),
 1653:                                    exit(Payload)
 1654:                            end),
 1655: 
 1656:               FlushTrace = fun F() ->
 1657:                                    receive
 1658:                                        {trace, Pid, _, _} ->
 1659:                                            F()
 1660:                                    after 0 ->
 1661:                                            ok
 1662:                                    end
 1663:                            end,
 1664: 
 1665:               erlang:trace(Pid, true, [exiting]),
 1666:               Pid ! go,
 1667:               receive
 1668:                   {trace, Pid, out_exited, 0} ->
 1669:                       FlushTrace()
 1670:               end
 1671:       end).
 1672: 
 1673: measure_latency_large_message(DataFun) ->
 1674: 
 1675:     erlang:system_monitor(self(), [busy_dist_port]),
 1676: 
 1677:     {ok, Peer, N} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1678: 
 1679:     Dropper = spawn(N, fun F() ->
 1680:                                process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1681:                                receive
 1682:                                    {monitor,Pid} ->
 1683:                                        erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 1684:                                        Pid ! ok;
 1685:                                    _ -> ok
 1686:                                end,
 1687:                                F()
 1688:                        end),
 1689: 
 1690:     Echo = spawn(N, fun F() -> receive {From, Msg} -> From ! Msg, F() end end),
 1691: 
 1692:     BuildType = erlang:system_info(build_type),
 1693:     WordSize = erlang:system_info(wordsize),
 1694: 
 1695:     if
 1696:         BuildType =/= opt; WordSize =:= 4 ->
 1697:             %% Test 3.2 MB and 32 MB and test the latency difference of sent messages
 1698:             Payloads = [{I, <<0:(I * 32 * 1024 * 8)>>} || I <- [1,10]];
 1699:         true ->
 1700:             %% Test 32 MB and 320 MB and test the latency difference of sent messages
 1701:             Payloads = [{I, <<0:(I * 32 * 1024 * 1024 * 8)>>} || I <- [1,10]]
 1702:     end,
 1703: 
 1704:     IndexTimes = [{I, measure_latency(DataFun, Dropper, Echo, P)}
 1705:                   || {I, P} <- Payloads],
 1706: 
 1707:     Times = [ Time || {_I, Time} <- IndexTimes],
 1708: 
 1709:     ct:pal("~p",[IndexTimes]),
 1710: 
 1711:     peer_stop(Peer, N),
 1712: 
 1713:     case {lists:max(Times), lists:min(Times)} of
 1714:         {Max, Min} when Max * 0.25 > Min, BuildType =:= opt ->
 1715:             %% We only issue a comment for this failure as the
 1716:             %% testcases proved very difficult to run successfully
 1717:             %% on many platforms.
 1718:             ct:comment({incorrect_latency, IndexTimes}),
 1719:             ok;
 1720:         _ ->
 1721:             ok
 1722:     end.
 1723: 
 1724: measure_latency(DataFun, Dropper, Echo, Payload) ->
 1725: 
 1726:     flush(),
 1727: 
 1728:     Senders = [spawn_monitor(
 1729:                  fun F() ->
 1730:                          DataFun(Dropper, Payload),
 1731:                          F()
 1732:                  end) || _ <- lists:seq(1,2)],
 1733: 
 1734:     %% Link in order to cleanup properly if TC crashes
 1735:     [link(Sender) || {Sender,_} <- Senders],
 1736: 
 1737:     wait_for_busy_dist(2 * 60 * 1000, 10),
 1738: 
 1739:     {TS, Times} =
 1740:         timer:tc(fun() ->
 1741:                          [begin
 1742:                               T0 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
 1743:                               Echo ! {self(), hello},
 1744:                               receive hello -> ok end,
 1745:                               (erlang:monotonic_time() - T0) / 1000000
 1746:                           end || _ <- lists:seq(1,100)]
 1747:                  end),
 1748:     Avg = lists:sum(Times) / length(Times),
 1749:     StdDev = math:sqrt(lists:sum([math:pow(V - Avg,2) || V <- Times]) / length(Times)),
 1750:     ct:pal("Times: Avg: ~p Max: ~p Min: ~p Var: ~p",
 1751:            [Avg, lists:max(Times), lists:min(Times), StdDev]),
 1752:     [begin
 1753:          unlink(Sender),
 1754:          exit(Sender,die),
 1755:          receive
 1756:              {'DOWN', Ref, process, _, _} ->
 1757:                  ok
 1758:          end
 1759:      end || {Sender, Ref} <- Senders],
 1760:     TS.
 1761: 
 1762: wait_for_busy_dist(_Tmo, 0) ->
 1763:     ok;
 1764: wait_for_busy_dist(Tmo, N) ->
 1765:     T0 = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
 1766:     receive
 1767:          {monitor, _Sender, busy_dist_port, _Info} ->
 1768:              wait_for_busy_dist(Tmo - (erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) - T0), N - 1)
 1769:     after Tmo ->
 1770:             ct:log("Timed out waiting for busy_dist, ~p left",[N]),
 1771:             timeout
 1772:     end.
 1773: 
 1774: flush() ->
 1775:     receive
 1776:         _ ->
 1777:             flush()
 1778:     after 0 ->
 1779:             ok
 1780:     end.
 1781: 
 1782: system_limit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1783:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
 1784:         8 ->
 1785:             SMD = memsup:get_system_memory_data(),
 1786:             case proplists:get_value(
 1787:                    available_memory, SMD,
 1788:                    proplists:get_value(system_total_memory, SMD)) of
 1789:                 Memory when is_integer(Memory),
 1790:                             Memory > 6*1024*1024*1024 ->
 1791:                     test_system_limit(Config),
 1792:                     garbage_collect(),
 1793:                     ok;
 1794:                 _ ->
 1795:                     {skipped, "Not enough memory on this machine"}
 1796:             end;
 1797:         4 ->
 1798:             {skipped, "Only interesting on 64-bit builds"}
 1799:     end.
 1800: 
 1801: test_system_limit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1802:     Bits = ((1 bsl 32)+1)*8,
 1803:     HugeBin = <<0:Bits>>,
 1804:     HugeListBin = [lists:duplicate(2000000,2000000), HugeBin],
 1805:     {ok, _Peer1, N1} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1806:     monitor_node(N1, true),
 1807:     receive
 1808:         {nodedown, N1} ->
 1809:             ct:fail({unexpected_nodedown, N1})
 1810:     after 0 ->
 1811:             ok
 1812:     end,
 1813:     P1 = spawn(N1,
 1814:                fun () ->
 1815:                        receive after infinity -> ok end
 1816:                end),
 1817: 
 1818:     io:format("~n** distributed send **~n~n", []),
 1819:     try
 1820:         P1 ! HugeBin,
 1821:         exit(oops1)
 1822:     catch
 1823:         error:system_limit -> ok
 1824:     end,
 1825:     try
 1826:         P1 ! HugeListBin,
 1827:         exit(oops2)
 1828:     catch
 1829:         error:system_limit -> ok
 1830:     end,
 1831: 
 1832:     io:format("~n** distributed exit **~n~n", []),
 1833:     try
 1834:         exit(P1, HugeBin),
 1835:         exit(oops3)
 1836:     catch
 1837:         error:system_limit -> ok
 1838:     end,
 1839:     try
 1840:         exit(P1, HugeListBin),
 1841:         exit(oops4)
 1842:     catch
 1843:         error:system_limit -> ok
 1844:     end,
 1845: 
 1846:     io:format("~n** distributed registered send **~n~n", []),
 1847:     try
 1848:         {missing_proc, N1} ! HugeBin,
 1849:         exit(oops5)
 1850:     catch
 1851:         error:system_limit -> ok
 1852:     end,
 1853:     try
 1854:         {missing_proc, N1} ! HugeListBin,
 1855:         exit(oops6)
 1856:     catch
 1857:         error:system_limit -> ok
 1858:     end,
 1859:     receive
 1860:         {nodedown, N1} ->
 1861:             ct:fail({unexpected_nodedown, N1})
 1862:     after 0 ->
 1863:             ok
 1864:     end,
 1865: 
 1866:     %%
 1867:     %% system_limit in exit reasons brings the
 1868:     %% connection down...
 1869:     %%
 1870: 
 1871:     io:format("~n** distributed link exit **~n~n", []),
 1872:     spawn(fun () ->
 1873:                   link(P1),
 1874:                   exit(HugeBin)
 1875:           end),
 1876:     receive {nodedown, N1} -> ok end,
 1877: 
 1878:     {ok, _Peer2, N2} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1879:     monitor_node(N2, true),
 1880:     P2 = spawn(N2,
 1881:                fun () ->
 1882:                        receive after infinity -> ok end
 1883:                end),
 1884:     spawn(fun () ->
 1885:                   link(P2),
 1886:                   exit(HugeListBin)
 1887:           end),
 1888:     receive {nodedown, N2} -> ok end,
 1889: 
 1890:     io:format("~n** distributed monitor down **~n~n", []),
 1891:     {ok, _Peer3, N3} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1892:     monitor_node(N3, true),
 1893:     Go1 = make_ref(),
 1894:     LP1 = spawn(fun () ->
 1895:                         receive Go1 -> ok end,
 1896:                         exit(HugeBin)
 1897:                 end),
 1898:     _ = spawn(N3,
 1899:                fun () ->
 1900:                        _ = erlang:monitor(process, LP1),
 1901:                        LP1 ! Go1,
 1902:                        receive after infinity -> ok end
 1903:                end),
 1904:     receive {nodedown, N3} -> ok end,
 1905: 
 1906:     {ok, _Peer4, N4} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1907:     monitor_node(N4, true),
 1908:     Go2 = make_ref(),
